metadata.title: CVE-2017-0841 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A remote code execution vulnerability in the Android system (libutils).Product: Android. Versions: 5.0.2, 5.1.1, 6.0, 6.0.1, 7.0, 7.1.1, 7.1.2,8.0. Android ID: A-37723026.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0841` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

adb - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-libadb - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-libbacktrace - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-libbase - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-libcutils - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-liblog - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-libsparse - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-libutils - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-libziparchive - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-platform-system-core-headers - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-tools-adb - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
android-tools-fastboot - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
append2simg - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
fastboot - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
img2simg - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
simg2img - 1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: android-platform-system-core package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:8.1.0+r3-5~18.04').
